resources.string: Press the hang up phone icon to finish the call
DANGER \nAre you sure you want to turn ON the laser?
Select the maximum radius you want the device to search for other devices
Press the Take Photo Button to take a photo
Press the Retake Photo button to take a photo again.\nPress the Identify button to identify what you\'ve just took a picture of.\nPress the Save button to save this picture in the gallery.
Press buttons +1/-1 to increase/decrease the value by 1\nPress buttons +10/-10 to increase/decrease the value by 10

Melting point - 2044 °C.\nIt is a rock-forming mineral. It is one of the naturally clear transparent materials, but can have different colors when impurities are present. Transparent specimens are used as gems, called ruby if red and padparadscha if a pink-orange, while all other colors are called sapphire.\nCorundum occurs as a mineral in mica schist, gneiss, and some marbles in Metamorphic terranes.

These amphibians are often called "dart frogs" due to the Amerindians' indigenous use of their toxic secretions to poison the tips of blowdarts.
Size: 1 cm -5 cm
Weight: 2 g
Most poison dart frogs are brightly colored to warn potential predators. Their bright coloration is associated with their toxicity and levels of alkaloids. Chemicals extracted from the skin of Epipedobates tricolor may be shown to have medicinal value. One such chemical is a painkiller 200 times as potent as morphine, called epibatidine. Secretions from dendrobatids are also showing promise as muscle relaxants, heart stimulants and appetite suppressants. The most poisonous of these frogs, the Golden Poison Frog (Phyllobates terribilis), has enough toxin on average to kill ten to twenty men or about ten thousand mice.
Press the Back button to go back.\nPress the Menu button to launch any other task.
Press the Settings button to change which animals/plants/minerals to track
Select the animal/plant/mineral you wish to track in the spinner and press Add\nTo remove a tracking press the corresponding Remove button\nPress Done to finish and save your settings
Select a picture to see it closer or press Take Photo button to take a photo
Select a video to play it or press Record Clip button to record a clip
Select the audio file you want to hear it
Type the name of the registry you want to find info about and press Search\nThen press Info on the registry you want to select
Type the name, info and select a picture of the registry you want to save
